info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 07 at 6:40PM MDT until June 07 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT/830 PM CDT/ FOR NORTHEASTERN YUMA...HITCHCOCK AND DUNDY COUNTIES... At 639 PM MDT/739 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Palisade to 8 miles southwest of Champion, moving southeast at 45 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR DUNDY AND HITCHCOCK COUNTIES. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 628 PM MDT, baseball size hail was reported south of Lamar, Nebraska. At 638 PM MDT, 66 mph wind gusts was reported near Wauneta, Nebraska. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Benkelman, Trenton, Culbertson, Palisade, Stratton, Max and Alvin. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
